  physical_appearance: This is a bound journal. It has a bible cover. The cover is brown and worn out
 especially along the spines. There are quite a number of scratches on the cover. In the center of the cover
 the words \u0027HOLY BIBLE\u0027 is inscribed with a slight indent.

  sgcool_label_text: The journal includes various paper scraps containing information related to the “Selarang incident”
 namely Selarang Special Orders issued by the Colonel and Commander of British and Australian troops which direct troops to sign the Japanese order promising that they will not try to escape. Most interesting of these orders is the assurance that pensions will be ensured upon the P.O.Ws’ release. The journal also includes a message from Major General Beckwith-smith on the unconditional surrender of Singapore as well as Lt. Gen. Sir Lewis Heath’s account of the Malayan campaign. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele
 Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942
 when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: The journal includes various paper scraps containing information related to the “Selarang incident”, namely Selarang Special Orders issued by the Colonel and Commander of British and Australian troops which direct troops to sign the Japanese order promising that they will not try to escape. Most interesting of these orders is the assurance that pensions will be ensured upon the P.O.Ws’ release. The journal also includes a message from Major General Beckwith-smith on the unconditional surrender of Singapore as well as Lt. Gen. Sir Lewis Heath’s account of the Malayan campaign. This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
